author: Emma Munbodh
title: 6 hacks to find cheap last minute holiday deals to Spain, Greece and Europe
text:
Spain and Greece are some of the most popular go-to destinations for British holiday-makers seeking cheap late getaways, family holidays and city breaks - and with temperatures rarely below 25-degrees - you're guaranteed to get your sun fix.
If you're looking for a cheap package deal or flight to the Mediterranean, and aren't sure where to start, take a look below for our top 6 hacks on how to find the best last minute deals .
For more holiday hacks, see our Tripadvisor bargain flights guide , or our easyJet deals page for how to spot a flight bargain.
1. For cheap on-the-day flights Compare prices using a website like Skyscanner to narrow down prices
For same-day flights, Tripadvisor has a handy 'lowest fares' section on their flights page with the cheapest flights of the day to Europe. Fares start at around £16 return.
easyJet 's cheap flights page lists the best last minute flight prices for 33 European destinations including Spain, Turkey and France. Enter your destination and dates to see what the lowest fares for you are.
Expedia's 'Travel Tonight' section lists the best package holidays for those travelling same-day, and prices start at £38 a night. The downside is that many of these depart from London only.
2. For flights this week Expedia's 'Travel this week' section lists their best package breaks each week with return fares to Europe across a number of budget and luxury airlines.
Lastminute.com is also a trusted source for late deals. The website covers flights , package breaks, all inclusive holidays and city breaks. For the best prices, see their seasonal reductions, where they have an array of May Fever deals currently running.
They also currently have a 30% off Barcelona hotels sale.
3. For holiday inspiration, on a budget Going somewhere hot? Broaden your options
Everybody knows that you need to be flexible when you’re looking for cheap flights - but not just with dates. Pick a destination based on where the cheapest flights are going and you'll save even more.
Holiday comparison site Skyscanner has an "everywhere" destination option. Use this tool to see which places are cheapest to visit on a short timescale.
British Airways' late deals page lists their best last minute package deals going in Europe and further afield. Browse the list for a holiday that suits your budget.
Another site to keep an eye on is Monarch Airlines as they list their best 10 late offers every week here .
4. For cheap hotels There are a number of websites that are handy for finding accomodation deals, as well as holiday rental sites like AirBnB . Some websites to check out include:
Lastminute villas
Tripadvisor's top 25 hotels, including best hotels on a budget, and best experience
Tripadvisor's holiday rentals page
Monarch Airlines' hotels from £1 a night
5. For cheap all inclusive breaks For a guaranteed stress-free break, you can go all inclusive, however these breaks do cost slightly more.
Thomas Cook's all inclusive deals page is update daily, and lists the best deals going last minute - prices start at around £400 per person.
There's also a handy guide on lastminute.com with the best late all inclusive deals -with the top 2 savings deals at the top.
6. For cheap family breaks Camping Les Pins Eurocamp's family breaks start at around £18 a night
If you're after a cheap summer holiday or half term break, Eurocamp is a good place to start. Similar to butlins, the camping specialists offer breaks across Europe from £128 for seven-nights - and the price always includes the whole family - usually up to nine people.
You can see their best late deals here , the best deals are usually to France or Spain. Flights are NOT included, however, you can use a budget airline or a ferry to cross the channel, with prices from £39 with P&O Ferries.
